channel.title: Masters of Social Gastronomy
channel.description: Recent content on Masters of Social Gastronomy

item.title: About M.S.G.
item.description: Once upon a time like a thousand years ago we had a conversation that was like “why isn’t there a S.A.S.S. about food?” and the end result was let’s do this. We talk about food, you drink couple hundred beers, everyone wins. Sarah Lohman of Four Pounds Flour is a historic gastronomist dedicated to uncovering the flavors of the past and using them to inspire contemporary cooking. She’ll drink colonial cocktails at daybreak and eat a moose’s face, all in the name of history.

item.title: Masters of Social Gastronomy Podcast
item.description: You can stream some of our past talks below, or find the MSG Podcast on SoundCloud. Previous Episodes

item.title: Upcoming + Past Events
item.description: The sensible thing to do is to just sign up for our email list to know when this stuff comes out. You can also check out our past events if you’re curious (there’s about a million years of them), or our podcast if you just can’t wait! August 27: The Secret History of Sushi Hosted at Caveat in the LES, tickets available here Sarah will present a history of sushi in the United States, a bizarre story bathed in celebrity.
